law.text:
// EFFECTIVE UNTIL SEPTEMBER 30, 2014 PER CHAPTERS 271 AND 272 OF 2011 //
A dental hygienist may monitor a patient to whom nitrous oxide is administered provided the monitoring of the patient is under the supervision of a dentist who is physically present on the premises.
Before a dental hygienist may monitor a patient to whom nitrous oxide is administered, the dental hygienist shall successfully complete the following:
Any educational requirements established by the Board; and
A written and clinical examination as required by the Board.
A dental hygienist shall complete the educational requirements established by the Board under subsection (b)(1) of this section through an accredited dental hygiene program.
